# Source: https://biomejs.dev/reference/environment-variables/

# Environment variables 

### `BIOME_LOG_PREFIX_NAME`

[[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)][Section titled "BIOME_LOG_PREFIX_NAME"]](#biome_log_prefix_name)

A prefix that's added to the name of the log. Default: `server.log.`

### `BIOME_LOG_PATH`

[[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)][Section titled "BIOME_LOG_PATH"]](#biome_log_path)

The directory where the Daemon logs will be saved.

### `BIOME_CONFIG_PATH`

[[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)][Section titled "BIOME_CONFIG_PATH"]](#biome_config_path)

A path to the configuration file

### `BIOME_BINARY`

[[![](data:image/svg+xml;base64,)][Section titled "BIOME_BINARY"]](#biome_binary)

Overrides the Biome binary being used. This allows you, for example, to use a system-wide Biome binary.

If you don't define this variable, Biome will automatically detect the correct binary for your platform.

<figure class="frame not-content">
<pre data-language="plaintext"><code>1# Nix derivation example; the binary path comes from &quot;$/bin/biome&quot;2BIOME_BINARY=/nix/store/68fyfw1hidsqkal1839whi3nzgvqv4pa-biome-1.0.0/bin/biome npx @biomejs/biome format .</code></pre>

</figure>
